name: Intenso Fermentation Roasted Coffee Beans
description:
This nano-lot from Baarbara Estate was produced by adding yeast to the ripened cherries in a controlled environment. The fermentation process results in notes of candied fruits and berries in the cup with a prominent acidity and complexity.

This is the first year we experiment with yeast fermentation. For this lot, we chose a yeast called Intenso (Saccharomyces cerevisiae), intended to increase fruity flavours, mouthfeel and general cup quality.

We found a floral aroma and notes of pomegranate, cherry, candied fruit and a hints of prunes supported by a smooth mouthfeel and the best way to enjoy this is to either brew a pour over or an iced coffee.

We have cupped this coffee multiple times in different stages of harvest and roast profiles. It can be strange and puzzling (in a nice way) because the flavours are constantly developing. It's like watching your favourite movie, that you've forgotten.

Origin - Single Origin

Altitude - 4500 ft - 5000 ft

Varietal - SLN 795

Roasted for - Filter

Best brewed as -Pour Over and Iced Coffees

Taste Notes - Pomegranate, Cherry, Candied Fruit & Prunes
